results.title: Van Gogh (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alain Resnais, Gaston Diehl, Pierre Braunberger, Robert Hessens and Films du Pantheon
results.brief_description: The life story of Vincent Van Gogh presented through the medium of his paintings. Mentions his early years as a preacher among miners in the Borinage, his resolution to abandon preaching in favour of painting, the period in Paris when he won the respect and admiration of artists, the flight to Province and finally his madness and eventual death. Mentions the chief influences on the development of Van Gogh’s distinctive technique. Narrated by Jim Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Resnais, Gaston Diehl, Pierre Braunberger, Robert Hessens and Films du Pantheon

results.title: Valley of power
results.brief_description: The Latrobe Valley, the site of the world’s largest single brown coal field and the centre of a large agricultural area. Shows the great power complex at Yallourn, Morwell and Hazelwood and the life of the people in the towns and surrounding countryside. The future of the valley and the State Electricity Commission is touched on.

results.title: Advanced science: vacuum practice
results.brief_description: The concept of vacuum and the application of high vacuum techniques. The pressure of a gas; various types of vacuum pumps; instruments for measuring degrees of vacuum; high vacuum techniques as applied in electronics, manufactures, metallurgy, pharmacy, the electron microscope and the apparatus of nuclear research.

results.title: The Vacant lot
results.creator_credit: Judith Merritt, Derek Lamb, Donald Brittain, Stanley Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The charming story of how a group of senior citizens managed to transform a useless vacant lot in Montreal into a garden of delights - vegetables, flowers, and parties. But the garden means much more to them than what it produces. It has completely changed their attitude about inactivity and retirement. Narrated by Patrick Watson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith Merritt, Derek Lamb, Donald Brittain, Stanley Jackson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Using our rivers
results.brief_description: Some of the New Zealand rivers and the ways in which they serve the interests of the country. There is water transport on the Wanganui River taking the Northland coal supply to Whangarei by scows. In the rivers of the West Coast, whitebait is harvested, and in the highlands the Cobb River serves a mountain power station.

results.title: Using lenses. Part 1. The lens turret
results.creator_credit: Mavis Lock and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a typical four-lens turret for the television camera, and how these lenses are used in different angles in television production without change of camera position.

results.title: Urban sprawl
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how new techniques of planning can promote orderly growth and development, thereby counteracting the natural tendency of urban sprawl which ultimately creates blighted communities. Includes scenes of the upper East Branch of Brandywine Creek near Philadelphia.

results.title: An Untitled film
results.creator_credit: David Gladwell and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. These strong images are accompanied by experimental music that compliments this well shot film.

results.title: Untitled: five Australian artists
results.brief_description: The work of five contemporary Australian sculptors - Tony Trembath, Ian Bracegirdle, Ross Grounds, Paul Stevenson-Ryan and Ray Woolard. The sculptors talk about their avant-garde sculptures, and see them as reflections on today’s society. They cite ecology, conservation and preserving the past as being important motivators in their work, and see their art as a way of living out their fantasies

results.title: Unmarried mothers
results.creator_credit: Michael Grigsby, Elaine Grand and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: A report on illegitimacy in Britain. Eight unmarried mothers are interviewed before and after the birth of their babies. They talk about contraception, abortion, adoption and the problems they face in society and in supporting a baby. The work of the National Council of the Unmarried Mother and Child, Mothers and Baby Homes and the social worker is shown. Narrated by Douglas Keay.
